description: From Latin remittent-, present participle of remittō.

adjectives.description: remittent (comparative more remittent, superlative most remittent)

entries.meaning: Alternately increasing and decreasing in severity or intensity.
examples: A remittent fever is when at certain periods the fever is more violent than at others, but the patient never intirely free from it.

entries.meaning: (rare) Of or pertaining to remission of the severity of symptoms.
examples: […]  the long, long fever of life, which with him never knew a remittent moment, had robbed him of that which every man has a right to expect, some pleasure in the course of his existence.
If you would have died from fever, you would have died at Ujiji when you had that severe attack of remittent.
